properties.name: Shatrana
properties.info: Ghaggar bed widens suddently to 6-8km here. Probably old branch of Sutlej met Ghaggar system here

properties.name: Sutlej feeder 1, Early Harappan
properties.map-notes: pg 98, 285 The Lost River, and paper on Sutlej glacial flow till -2500. Early date as per Kenoyer.

properties.name: Markand
properties.map-notes: pg 58,285 The Lost River. Markand received part of head waters of Yamuna earlier

properties.name: Saraswati
properties.info: Course of ancient Saraswati river, as recreated from multiple documents, but primarily the excellent book by Michel Danino: The Lost River - On the trail of the SARASVATI. The course shows the Ghagghar joining Sarsuti near Rasulpur. This combined stream joins Chautang aka Drishdavati near Hanumangarh and flows into Pakistan beyond Anupgarh. In the past, a tributary of Sutlej (not shown) would have also met the upper arm which likely resulted in the snow-fed year round river that was described in the Vedas. TODO - update course with time

properties.name: Sarsuti
properties.map-notes: Rise in Sirmur hills, touches plains near AdBadri, joins Ghaggar near Rasula - halfway between Kaithal and Shatrana

properties.name: Ghaggar
properties.map-notes: Rise near Dagshai, touches plains near Pinjore, flows past north of Ambala. Receives Sarsuti near Rasula. The channel suddenly becomes 6-8km wide near Shatrana, presumably spot where Vedic-Sutlej channel met this river system.

properties.name: Drisdavati
properties.map-notes: Started at Yamunanagar and north of Kaithal, west turn near Hansi, past Hisar, Bhadra, Nohar, Rawatsar, Badopal

properties.name: Sravasti
properties.info: Center of Buddhism for 1800 years upto 12th century AD. Key trade center in its heyday, center for trade, religion, and culture. Materially prosperous, well planned city.

properties.info: Saketa was an important Kosala city, one of the six great cities of ancient India in the time preceding Buddha. On route to Sravasti and Kosambi.

properties.name: Sagala
properties.info: Alexander Cunningham notes surrounding country is still known as Madr-desa (p.185 Geography of Ancient India)

properties.name: Sagala
properties.info: At time of Alexander, city of Sagala was at site of this hill, as per Alexander Cunningham (p. 185 Geography of Ancient India), to west of Ravi. Nearby is railway station called Bhalike!

properties.name: Amba
properties.info: Several ancient mounds, locals mention Raja Amba established these about 2000 years back. Alexander Cunningham (P.195 Geography of Ancient India) identifies with Kanishka and his two brothers.

properties.name: Balkh
properties.info: origin of Madra tribes in Punjab

properties.name: Markoh
properties.info: Alexander

properties.name: Mulasthana
properties.info: Ancient Sun temple existed at Multan. Believed to have been built by Samba, son of Krishna. Hiuen Tsang mentions idol of pure gold with eyes of rubies.AlBiruni etc described it. Destroyed by 10th Century. Malli tribes defeated by Alexander

properties.name: Piprawa
properties.info: Buddha's relics found here. Meant for his Sakya clan, in addition to a small treasure including drilled beads, gold stars, gold flowers etc.

properties.name: Puskalavati
properties.info: Ancient city, dated remains to 1400BC. Panini supposed to have lived here. Part of various empires

properties.name: Taksasila
properties.info: Ancient center of learning, one of the capitals of Gandhara, along with Puskalavati.
